alert.note: Alert for Dickey (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 19 at 11:36AM CDT until further notice by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota...North Dakota... Maple River Near Frederick affecting Brown and Dickey Counties. .Warm temperatures will the recent snowmelt continue to keep the river levels elevated. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Maple River Near Frederick. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, The water reaches the bottom of the bridge 2 miles north of the gage At 10.5 feet, The bridge 2 miles north of the gage is overtopped * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:16 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 10.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:16 AM CDT Wednesday was 11.7 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued Thursday evening by 745 PM CDT.
